好易認

【now.com體育】謝拉特日前在社交網絡首次分享了孻仔里奧佐治的照片，雖然小孩子照片中睡得正濃，但仍然看得出五官端正，是靚仔一名。

謝拉特（Steven Gerrard）上星期宣佈喜獲麟兒，並為愛子取名為里奧佐治謝拉特，這位前紅軍隊長坦言得此孻仔後，家庭就變得完整，然而，他一直未有分享愛兒的相片，小謝拉特到底是甚麼樣子，一直是個謎。

直到今日，謝四終於把謎底揭開，在社交網絡instagram貼出了「謝孻仔」的照片，照片所見，里奧佐治正身處一個舒適的環境中甜睡，面露絲絲笑容，儘管只出生1星期，但看得出他是帥哥一名。

謝拉特於照片旁邊沒有加上任何說話，只加上了一個心型圖案，的確是心意猶勝千言萬語，對愛兒的愛由此可見，始終「孻仔拉心肝」，理解的。

圖片來源 : ©AFP

Klopp: "This club has such a power that when you all go in the same direction together it is one of the most powerful clubs in the world."

Klopp: "This power we're really planning to use tomorrow, next week & for the rest of our lives - this is the biggest strength of the club."

Klopp: "I am not sure the use of it in the last few years has been in the right way so I am happy with the start but we can all improve."

Klopp: "Winning close games is really important but winning other games is also important because that is still the most difficult thing."

Klopp: "Is there ever a moment when you're good enough? We have won 3 & lost one of them and still we have the image that we lose them all."

Klopp: "No team has this image like we have, we win against them (the top teams) but we lose against them (the lesser sides) but we're 3rd."
Klopp believes his side are facing an image problem amongst the Premier League, with no team judged as harshly as Liverpool.

Jurgen Klopp admits the calibre of player he desires this summer means Liverpool will face stiff competition to land their transfer targets.

But the German coach admits he is ready to “eat a lot of frogs” - or, in a more familiar English phrase, “bite the bullet” - to land them.


The Reds are eyeing the likes of Virgil van Dijk and Naby Keita to strengthen their squad next season, with Champions League football imperative to bring them to Anfield.

Klopp had previously suggested he would not be interested in players who were only interested in competing in Europe’s top competition, but concedes that is what the majority of top talent across the continent wants.

The 49-year-old maintains he does not want to sign those who want to join his side just because of their place in the Champions League – but concedes he will bring them to the club whichever way he can.

Back in April last year, Klopp said: “So if I would speak to a player now and he would tell me: ‘if you were playing in the Champions League next year I would be really interested’, I would put the phone down from my side. I am not interested.”

When his previous comments were put to him, Klopp replied:

“I really forgot a lot of the things I said in the past! What I thought was that if Champions League is the only thing they’re looking for then I can’t. I don’t want him.

When his previous comments were put to him, Klopp replied:

“I really forgot a lot of the things I said in the past! What I thought was that if Champions League is the only thing they’re looking for then I can’t. I don’t want him.

Jurgen Klopp admits the calibre of player he desires this summer means Liverpool will face stiff competition to land their transfer targets.

But the German coach admits he is ready to “eat a lot of frogs” - or, in a more familiar English phrase, “bite the bullet” - to land them.

The Reds are eyeing the likes of Virgil van Dijk and Naby Keita to strengthen their squad next season, with Champions League football imperative to bring them to Anfield.

Klopp had previously suggested he would not be interested in players who were only interested in competing in Europe’s top competition, but concedes that is what the majority of top talent across the continent wants.

The 49-year-old maintains he does not want to sign those who want to join his side just because of their place in the Champions League – but concedes he will bring them to the club whichever way he can.

Back in April last year, Klopp said: “So if I would speak to a player now and he would tell me: ‘if you were playing in the Champions League next year I would be really interested’, I would put the phone down from my side. I am not interested.”

When his previous comments were put to him, Klopp replied:


“I really forgot a lot of the things I said in the past! What I thought was that if Champions League is the only thing they’re looking for then I can’t. I don’t want him.

“But if it’s part of whatever and the player has different options and the others play Champions League and we are the only club that doesn’t - it’s all about if he’s the right player.

“In Germany we say we have to eat a lot of frogs. We have to wait for different reasons, we have to take it. Bite the bullet, yes.

“The better the players, the more other clubs want them and we cannot go for players saying only that Liverpool is a wonderful city. There are a few other things you have to bring in.

“We are in good talks and we’ll see what happens but it would help to qualify, that’s for sure.

"We need to be brave, we need to use the crowd."
